title: The Why, How and What of America
summary: Readings to appreciate the making of our nation and its continuing miracle.. I'm not really big on purple mountain majesties. I'd love America if it were a hole in the ground though yes, it's beautiful. I don't love it only because it's "an idea," as we all say now. That strikes me as a little bloodless. Baseball didn't come from an idea, it came from us-a long cool game punctuated by moments of high excellence and utter heartbreak, a team sport in which each player operates on his own. The great movie about America's pastime isn't called "Field of Ideas," it's called "Field of Dreams." And the scene that makes every grownup weep is when the dark-haired young catcher steps out of the cornfield and walks toward Kevin Costner, who suddenly realizes: That's my father.

title: What You Need to Garden-Party Into the Night
summary: From patio to pool deck, use these portable outdoor lamps to outmaneuver nightfall. I have a garden. It's just a small plot in the back of our Brooklyn townhouse that was nothing but a petite expanse of scrubby dirt, Japanese knot weeds and piles of unwanted bricks when we moved in in 2010. Oh, and the enigmatic remains of a cistern. Then we hired a thoughtful landscape architect with a soft, reassuring Kentucky accent, and bit by bit, our "garden" turned into something you might actually want to Instagram. The weeds were vanquished, if not the mosquitoes. The plants arrived. The easy-to-overthink process of choosing outdoor pillows began. We started to live something approximating the "good life" back there. But there was a problem: We never got around to lighting the garden. Cocktails with friends turned into murky, amateur events come dusk. Squinting. Defeat, and into the house we went. That's why I eye these outdoor lanterns covetously. Perhaps, this summer, our garden can finally play an after-dark role in our lives.

title: Lagarde Likely Would Keep ECB on Current Course

title: Biden Has Raised $21.5 Million Since Entering Race in Late April

title: We Want to Live In This Beach House. Or at Least Fake It.
summary: How to recreate this corner of a Hampton Bays, N.Y., beach house, designed to let the owners commune with sunset-even if you lack a view. IN A NOOK at the back of a Hampton Bays, N.Y., summer home, all design decisions were made to let the woman who lives there take in the blood-pressure-lowering view of the bay. "She likes to cozy up on that chair, relax and enjoy the sunset with a glass of wine and a book," said New York designer Brittany Marom. Though it might seem odd to plan décor around such a narrow window of opportunity, even the wall covering-cork with a metallic finish-was chosen to play with the slanting light. "The silvered cork blends with the rest of the neutrals in the house," said Ms. Marom, "but when the sun hits it, it has a beautiful sparkle without being shiny." Here, five other design moves that make this subtle space work.

title: Is It Ever OK to Wear Swim Trunks as Shorts?
summary: Increasingly, yes and with good reason: They're fast-drying, sporty and stain-resistant. Of course, there's the pockets question.... IN THE 1966 documentary "The Endless Summer," two surfers embark on an adventure around the world. The film teems with epic swells, sun-drenched beaches and devil-may-care surfers in smart swim trunks. Those retro beach bums love their waterproof shorts so much that they wear them on dry land as if they were regular shorts. In one scene, the fashion rule-breakers pair trunks with a blue oxford shirt and cardigan sweater; in another, with a crisp white polo shirt. It turns out these overenthusiastic swimwear devotees were onto something: In 2019, trunks-as-shorts are having another moment in the sun.

title: To Cut Urban Bloodshed, Focus on Violent Hot Spots
summary: By targeting the limited number of people and places involved in most killings, new anticrime programs can have a huge effect. Hospital emergency rooms run on the principle of triage. title: The Seven Deadly Don'ts of Wine
summary: Our wine columnist loves what she does-but doesn't hesitate to call out the cheap, the shoddy, the ill-conceived and the simply bad when she sees them. There are also lesser versions of all of these things-some worse than others. As a columnist tasked with writing on the topic each week, I keep a running list of all that I love about wine, and all that I dislike as well. Right now, nothing irks me more than the seven wine "sins" enumerated here, each deadly in its own way.

title: Rescue-Ship Fracas Revives Europe's Migrant Debate
summary: Interior Minister Matteo Salvini vows to expel Carola Rackete for bringing rescued migrants into Italy. A pitched battle of wills between Italy's leading nativist politician and the German captain of a migrant-rescue ship has divided European Union governments and highlighted the unresolved problem of Mediterranean migration.

title: New Rule to Test Union Membership, Finances
summary: Latest challenge for unions could endanger $150 million in dues. Two of the nation's most powerful unions face a potential loss of members and millions of dollars when a Trump administration rule takes effect Friday in the latest big test for organized labor.

title: Bitcoin Rally Fuels Crypto Derivatives
summary: New structured products draw concern as digital currency climbs back above $10,000. Wall Street has dreamed up an array of derivatives tied to stocks, commodities and mortgages. Now such contracts are being developed for bitcoin.

title: U.S. Private Sector Added 102,000 Jobs in June
summary: Small businesses lost 23,000 jobs in the month. The U.S. private sector added 102,000 nonfarm jobs for June, less than economists were expecting, with growth being driven by the service-producing sector and hurt by small businesses.

title: Chuck E. Cheese Mouse Stumbles into Bitcoin Trap
summary: Resume Subscription. Bitcoin enthusiasts don't take insults on Twitter lying down.

title: Arizona Mayor to Nike: We Still Want You, Even if Governor Doesn't
summary: Goodyear city officials will honor incentives for proposed 500-job Nike factory after Gov. Ducey pulls state support. The mayor of Goodyear, Ariz., said local officials still wanted Nike Inc. to open a factory in the city after the governor of the state pulled his support for the project in protest of the sneaker giant's decision not to sell a shoe featuring an early American flag.

title: High-Tech Disruptors of Bond Market Enjoy Stock Surge
summary: Shares of two electronic bond-trading companies have gained as some investors foresee market transformation. Investors have richly rewarded a pair of companies that are bringing electronic trading to the bond market, which has long been dominated by Wall Street banks making deals by phone, email and instant message.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: When It Comes to Colin Kaepernick, the Flag and Nike, It's Just Business
summary: The sneaker company made a calculated decision in hiring the former quarterback after the national anthem controversy. Pulling the Betsy Ross shoes after his objection to their sale was consistent with that move.. For Nike , backing Colin Kaepernick is strictly good business.

title: Trump Taps Judy Shelton, Christopher Waller for Fed Board
summary: President to nominate pair of economists after two of his original choices withdrew themselves from consideration. WASHINGTON-President Trump plans to nominate economists Judy Shelton and Christopher Waller to fill two board vacancies at the Federal Reserve, after months of pressing the central bank to lower interest rates.

title: Girl, 2, Goes Missing While Crossing the Rio Grande
summary: The Brazilian girl's mother told Border Patrol agents that she had lost her daughter in the river. A 2-year-old Brazilian girl is missing after she was washed away from her mother while crossing the Rio Grande near Del Rio, Texas, the Border Patrol said.

title: Brazilian President's Pension Bill Advances in the Lower House
summary: The bill, which would set a minimum retirement age, would fall short of initially predicted savings of $323 billion. SÃO PAULO-Brazil's lower house speaker estimated Tuesday that an amended proposal to overhaul the country's insolvent pension system could save about $245 billion over the next decade, enough to ease fears over a full-blown fiscal crisis.

title: How Do You Move a 60-Ton Tank Across Washington?
summary: The U.S. military is about to find out. WASHINGTON-The U.S. military, famed for its ability to rapidly deploy to the far corners of the globe, is facing a new logistical challenge: How to get two heavy tanks across roughly 3 miles of the nation's capital without tearing up roads and bridges before President Trump's Fourth of July celebration.

title: U.S. Drops Citizenship Question From Census
summary: Move marks reversal for administration and victory for civil-rights advocates. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration dropped plans to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census form, a turnaround after days of defiant statements following last week's Supreme Court decision to halt the query.

title: Christopher Waller: In His Own Words
summary: Some of his research hints at policy positions he might adopt if confirmed to Fed board. Christopher Waller, President Trump's pick for a seat on the Federal Reserve's board of governors, has spent his career in academia and at the St. Louis Fed, where he is research director. His work is mostly technical, and much of it touches on how the effect of monetary policy is transmitted to the economy. Still, some of his research hints at policy positions he might adopt if he is confirmed to a board seat.

title: Nike Defends Pulling 'Betsy Ross' Sneaker as Arizona Governor Withdraws Aid
summary: Nike employees were confused when Colin Kaepernick objected to early U.S. flag; Arizona's governor protests Nike, while New Mexico's woos it. Nike Inc. defended its decision to pull a July Fourth shoe from shelves after NFL-star-turned-activist Colin Kaepernick objected to the design, a move that stoked controversy inside and outside the sneaker giant.

title: Homeland Security Report Details Poor Conditions in Border Patrol Stations
summary: Inspector general's report describes overcrowding, cites Border Patrol agent referring to 'ticking time bomb'. LOS ANGELES-Conditions at Border Patrol stations in South Texas are so grim that migrant men detained in one facility pleaded for help from government inspectors visiting in June, according to an internal watchdog report released Tuesday.

title: U.A.E. Moves to Extricate Itself From Yemen War
summary: Military withdrawal from the campaign against Houthi rebels comes amid tensions between U.S. and Iran. WASHINGTON-The United Arab Emirates is aiming to pull most of its forces out of the Saudi-led campaign against Houthi rebels in Yemen, extricating itself from a four-year war that has provoked congressional opposition and has become a flashpoint with Iran in the region.
